title: 10 Tarnish-Free Gold Jewelry Brands To Wear (& Gift) Nonstop
text:
10 Tarnish-Free Gold Jewelry Brands To Wear (& Gift) Nonstop

Tarnish-free gold jewelry sounds like the ultimate cheat code â€” pieces that wonâ€™t fade, dull, or turn your skin green, no matter how much you wear them. But do they exist on a budget? The short answer: kind of. Unless youâ€™re investing in solid gold (which is costly), no jewelry is completely resistant to wear over time. But thanks to smarter materials and better plating techniques, you can get long-lasting shine without the hefty price tag.Â 

â€œâ€˜Tarnish-freeâ€™ means the jewelry is resistant to discoloration from air, moisture, or skin oils,â€ explains Jennie Yoon, founder and CEO of Kinn Studio. â€œWhile no jewelry material is completely immune to wear over time, tarnish-free pieces are designed to maintain their original appearance for much longer.â€ The key? High-quality base metals, thicker gold layers, and protective coatings that help plated pieces hold up to daily wear.Â 

One of the biggest game-changers in affordable jewelry is physical vapor deposition (PVD), a high-tech plating method that makes gold layers tougher, thicker, and more resistant to fading. â€œRecent advancements like PVD coating, thicker micron plating, and anti-tarnish treatments allow us to create beautiful, long-lasting pieces at a price point that is accessible to more people,â€ Yoon explains.Â 

But longevity isnâ€™t just about the plating method â€” it also comes down to how you wear and care for your jewelry. â€œAvoid exposure to water, sweat, and chemicals like perfumes or cleaning products,â€ Yoon advises. â€œStoring your pieces in a cool, dry place and cleaning them with a soft cloth can make a huge difference in keeping them looking newâ€¦ A well-made piece of plated jewelry can last for years with proper care.â€Â 

So whatâ€™s the difference between gold plating, vermeil, and solid gold? Gold plating is the most affordable, but itâ€™s also the least durable â€” just a thin layer of gold over brass or stainless steel. Vermeil is a step up, with a thicker layer of gold over sterling silver, making it more resistant to tarnishing. And solid gold? Thatâ€™s literally the gold standard for jewelry that stays pristine forever â€” but at a cost.Â Ahead, weâ€™re breaking down the best tarnish-free gold jewelry brands for everyday wear â€” whether youâ€™re looking for an investment piece, fun Valentineâ€™s Day-coded heart-shaped design, or everyday go-to hoops that wonâ€™t quit.

DashDividers_1_500x100

Mejuri

By far one of the most beloved jewelry brands, Mejuri makes some of the best everyday jewelry â€” from delicate and sparkly to bold and lustrous. With a commitment to 95% recycled gold, the brand blends sustainability with durability, offering everything from solid 14K gold designed for nonstop wear to 18K gold vermeil layered over sterling silver for long-lasting shine. Whether youâ€™re finally splurging on that investment piece or adding to your daily stack, these designs are made to go the distance.

Shop all Mejuri jewelry

DashDividers_1_500x100

Ana Luisa

Mega-affordable and packed with all the hits, Ana Luisa delivers sparkly hoops, delicate studs, dangly earrings, and layerable chains alongside solid gold, pearl, and diamond pieces â€” all without the steep markup. Known for its tarnish-free, hypoallergenic, and waterproof edits, the brand rigorously tests every piece to ensure it holds up to daily wear. With a focus on recycled materials and responsible sourcing, plus a two-year warranty and over 50,000 five-star reviews, these are the kind of staples you can count on.

Shop all Ana Luisa jewelry

DashDividers_1_500x100

Monica Vinader

Monica Vinader reimagines fine jewelry through the lens of fluid, organic shapes and nature-inspired textures, resulting in pieces that feel both effortless and quietly striking. From sculptural pearl drops and softly contoured gold bands to gemstone beaded bracelets with molten-like detailing, each design embraces natural irregularities that set it apart. Crafted from 100% recycled gold and sterling silver, the brandâ€™s jewelry doesnâ€™t just look refined â€” itâ€™s tarnish-resistant and designed for everyday wear. And now, traceable lab-grown diamonds bring high-wattage shine to the mix.

Shop all Monica Vinader jewelry

DashDividers_1_500x100

Catbird

The purveyors of all things teensy, delicate, and just left of center, Catbird makes cool-person jewelry â€” the kind you collect, stack, and never take off. Designed in Brooklyn and crafted with over 95% recycled 14K solid gold and recycled diamonds, the brandâ€™s whisper-thin rings, glimmering chains, and tiny starry diamonds wonâ€™t tarnish, fade, or lose their glow. Catbird also practically invented the stacking game â€” and changed jewelry again with permanent Forever Bracelets, clasp-free solid gold chains custom-fitted and welded directly onto your wrist for a seamless look thatâ€™s become a signature of the effortlessly stylish.

Shop all Catbird jewelry

DashDividers_1_500x100

Missoma

From bold, trendy statement jewelry to timeless classics, Missoma has made demi-fine jewelry a must-have. Designed in London and handcrafted for stacking, the brand delivers statement chains, bold hoops, and stackable rings in recycled 18K gold vermeil, gold plated, and sterling silver. Covetable collaborations with fashion notables like Lucy Williams and Harris Reed â€” as well as an appearance in the Barbie movie â€” only add to its cult status. And for those ready to invest? The Missoma Fine collection elevates bestsellers in recycled 14K solid gold and diamonds â€” classic, with a twist.

Shop all Missoma jewelry

DashDividers_1_500x100

Jenny Bird

Every fashion insider knows that Jenny Bird delivers the bold hoops, eye-catching chains, and sleek cuffs that instantly pull a look together. R29 editors, including swear by the brand for pieces, such as the water-durable collection, that can handle nonstop wear. Crafted from recycled 14K solid gold and ultra-durable stainless steel, these essentials bring the statement without tarnish or green marks.Â 

Shop all Jenny Bird jewelry

DashDividers_1_500x100

BaubleBar

You know and love BaubleBar for its playful pieces and budget-friendly price tags, but, as part of its fine jewelry collection, the brand also delivers on tarnish-resistant jewelry crafted from 14K and 18K gold-plated sterling silver for a luxe look without the splurge. From layer-ready chains and sleek gold rings to statement earrings that sparkle, these pieces let you pile on the shine without the stress â€” just fun, accessible, and mixable staples.

Shop all BaubleBar jewelry

DashDividers_1_500x100

Electric Picks

Youâ€™ve likely spotted Electric Picks on your favorite influencers and celebs â€” the brand has a way of making jewelry feel personal, storied, and achingly cool. With 14K solid gold and 14K gold-plated styles, these pieces are tarnish-resistant and built for daily wear. The vibe spectrum is just as dynamic â€” with collections that mix chains with natural elements like pearls and shells, and transforming charms, tokens, and coins from around the world into modern heirlooms.

Shop all Electric Picks jewelry

DashDividers_1_500x100

Kinn

Kinn is redefining modern heirlooms with fine jewelry crafted to stand the test of time. With solid gold as the foundation â€” the ultimate standard in tarnish-free wear â€” and high-quality vermeil built for longevity, these pieces are designed to be worn daily rather than saved for special occasions. â€œBalancing affordability with quality requires a commitment to using high-quality materials, such as sterling silver bases for vermeil or thicker gold plating,â€ explains Yoon. The result? Investment-worthy staples that wonâ€™t lose their luster, whether you wear them for years or pass them down for generations.

Shop all Kinn jewelry

DashDividers_1_500x100

Hey Harper

Not all gold-plated jewelry can handle real life â€” but Hey Harper can. Known for its waterproof, tarnish-resistant designs, the brand has perfected PVD-coated jewelry that wonâ€™t fade, chip, or turn your skin green. With prices starting around $25, itâ€™s an easy choice for everyday staples, from stackable bracelets and bold rings to layer-ready chains.Â 

Shop all Hey Harper jewelry

Like what you see? How about some more R29 goodness, right here?

Gold Hoops For Every Vibe: From 14k To Huggies

Get Galentineâ€™s Day-Ready With Urban Outfitters

Gifts For Women Who Have Everything & Want Nothing

title: Iced Coffee Glass Nails Is The Luxe Manicure Everyoneâ€™s About To Copy
text:
Iced Coffee Glass Nails Is The Luxe Manicure Everyoneâ€™s About To Copy

An in-depth scroll of my camera roll would reveal nothing scandalousÂ â€”Â just an alarming quantity ofÂ nail inspiration.Â No, really.Â I have moreÂ screenshotsÂ ofÂ blue suede nails,Â polka dot prints, andÂ argyleÂ sweater-inspiredÂ manicuresÂ than IÂ haveÂ photos of my friends and family.Â Â 

My obsession withÂ nail artÂ puts me in a strong position toÂ identifyÂ the coolest emerging trends, and if you ask me, nothing is quite as mesmerizing as what manicurists are calling â€œiced coffee glassâ€ nails.Â 

What areÂ iced coffee glass nails,Â and how do you get the look?Â 

Also known as â€œribbed glassâ€ nails, the look is inspired by the dainty coffee glasses currently dominating Pinterest and the feeds of your favorite lifestyle brands.Â 

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by Elizabeth | Miami nail tech (@nailedxeliz)

Session manicuristÂ Ami StreetsÂ says iced coffee glass nails are so popularÂ right nowÂ because they tap into what she calls the soft luxury aesthetic. â€œAmplified by social media and satisfying magnetic effects, iced coffee nails feel modern, elevated, and luxurious,â€ says Streets. She explains that itÂ blends multiple major trends:Â â€œThinkÂ glazed andÂ glass finishes, as well asÂ magnetic manicures,â€Â she says,Â essentially cat-eyeÂ polish, whichÂ containsÂ magnetic particles that are maneuvered into place with a magnet before it cures.Â 

While ribbed glass nails come in a variety of shades, one color paletteÂ seems to beÂ reigning supreme:Â â€œBrown tones have been a dominant trending color and are set to continue as a key colorÂ movementÂ in 2026,â€ says Streets.Â â€œThe warm neutrals paired with aÂ glossy,Â translucent sheen create depth and movement that mimics coffee in a glass.â€Â Weâ€™re just a little bit in love with these espresso nails courtesy of @Nails_ByLes on Instagram.

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by ğğšğ¢ğ¥ğ¬ğğ²ğ‹ğğ¬ (@nails_byles)

How doÂ youÂ achieve iced coffee glass nails?Â 

Though this manicure might look complicated, an experienced nail artist will know exactly what to do. Streets explains, â€œTo create iced coffee glass nails with a ribbed-glass effect, start with a sheer brown gel base in latte, caramel, or iced-coffee tones.â€Â She adds that your nail tech will layerÂ the polishÂ according to your opacity preference.Â â€œOne to two thin coats will be more translucent rather than opaque, or for added depth, you can layer a subtle magnetic brown or taupe gel and softly activate the magnet to create gentle movement that mimics liquid in a glass.â€Â 

The next step is sealing in the cat-eye color with a high-shineÂ top coat, curing it under a UV lamp, and then applying aÂ matteÂ top coatÂ over the entire nail. â€œThis will help achieve that frosted, iced glass finish,â€ says Streets.Â 

Now for theÂ finishing touch: once bothÂ top coatsÂ are cured, a clear builder gel or thick clearÂ top coatÂ is used to draw raised vertical lines, Streets explains. â€œThese extend from the cuticle to the free edge and should be evenly spaced to resemble ribbed drinking glasses,â€ she says. The nails are then fully cured. â€œThe glossy lines will appear raised while the rest of the nail remains matte,â€ says Streets, â€œand itâ€™s the contrast between soft-focus glass and high-shine ribs that gives this manicure an elevated, dimensional finish.â€Â 

Because there are quite a few steps,Â donâ€™tÂ expect this to be a quickÂ salon visit. Iced glass nails can take a couple of hours in the salon chair, as moving the magnetic particles into place to make the finish look like liquid takes time and precision. Your nails might take even longer ifÂ youâ€™reÂ opting for a builder gel or hard gel base, which requires extra layering and curing.Â 

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by Vacaville, CA | BIANCA (@allthingsbybb)

The best iced coffee glass nail inspiration on Instagram:Â Â 

Coffee and nude tones might be de rigueur among ribbed glass nail obsessives, but there are no rules when it comes to choosing a shade. Ahead, find the best ribbed glass nail inspiration in a variety ofÂ different colors.Â 

Antique GlassÂ Â 

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by GOOSE (@goose.beauty)

Nail salon GooseÂ takes cues from alchemy, inspired by the deep green potion bottles of centuries past. We love this high voltage hueÂ â€” a cat-eye polish that looks as though it has been painted over aÂ jet-blackÂ base to really pop.Â 

Magenta GlassÂ 

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by Nailporn (@nailporn)

WeÂ canâ€™tÂ take our eyes away from these multidimensional magenta nails byÂ Nail Porn, which gleam in purple, pink, and orange as the light shifts.Â 

Fire GlassÂ 

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by Lilly | Denver Nail Artist (@the.lillyedit)

Denver-basedÂ nail artist LillyÂ makes these glass nails flicker like a burning fireplace, layering burnt orange cat-eye polish over a black base.Â 

Sea GlassÂ 

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by Clarisa Maldonado (@nailskiezzbyclari)

Hazy sea glass inspires these blue-green nails byÂ Clarisa Maldonado, where a glossyÂ top coatÂ over cat-eye polish and delicate silvery lines make them catch the light from every angle.Â 

Wine Glass

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by ari | licensed nail technician (@thecuticlecove)

Licensed nail technician AriÂ shows how to elevate a classic burgundy, pairing a matte base with sleek, glossy stripes.Â 

Champagne GlassÂ 

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by ğŸ’…ğŸ½ ğ–ğ–”ğ–šğ–— ğ–’ğ–†ğ–šğ– ğ–“ğ–†ğ–ğ–‘ ğ–Œğ–ğ–—ğ–‘ âœ¨ (@mayleidoesnails)

Nail artist @mayleidoesnailsÂ usedÂ structured gelÂ â€” a harder, more durable gel â€” to createÂ these twinkling, champagne-esqueÂ glass nails.Â 

Azure GlassÂ 

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by Elizabeth | Miami nail tech (@nailedxeliz)

Miami nail tech Elizabethâ€˜s take on the glass manicureÂ brings to mindÂ boat trips on the Mediterranean. TheÂ top coatÂ stripes make the dark blueÂ cat-eyeÂ polish appear azure in places.Â Â 

Midnight GlassÂ 

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by Gel X By shirel ash (@manisbyash)

Shirel Ash plays with a dark base, silver cat-eye polish, and ultra-fineÂ top coatÂ lines to create a look that evokes a starry midnight sky.Â 

Golden Glass

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by ğ™ğ™˜ğ™–ğ™§ğ™¡ğ™šğ™©ğ™ (@scaviar.nails)

The light bounces beautifully off these golden-brown nails by Scarleth, and the almond shape is the cherry on top.

Violet GlassÂ 

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by Beth | Nail Technician (@nailsby_bjp_)

The Gel Bottleâ€™s cat-eye polish in Vault is behind this violet-meets-silver set byÂ nail technician Beth.Â Weâ€™reÂ taking this one to our nail salon, stat.Â Â 

Iced AmericanoÂ 

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by JUST LOLS (@justlolsnails)

A range of coffee-toned shades come together in this manicure byÂ JustÂ LolsÂ Nails, with stripesÂ renderedÂ in a deeper hue rather than a clearÂ top coat, adding layers and dimension.Â

title: I Tried 8 Peptide Lip Treatments â€” & The Cheapest Was The Winner
text:
I Tried 8 Peptide Lip Treatments â€” & The Cheapest Was The Winner

Take a closer look at some of todayâ€™s hottest beauty products, and youâ€™ll likely find peptides front and center in the ingredients list. These buzzy amino acids â€” which promote hydration and collagen production â€” have been making their way into everything from lightweight moisturizers to viral cream blushes, but their most exciting role might be in lip treatments.

â€œThe skin on your lips is very thin and delicate and can be prone to dehydration,â€ says consultant dermatologist Dr. Milena Al Mansuri. She adds, â€œPeptides are therefore great for lips because they help to strengthen the barrier, which in turn helps to lock moisture in; they can also help protect your lips from damaging environmental factors such as the sun and wind.â€ (Adding a top layer of sun protection is still essential for your lips, as UV rays can break down collagen.)

But hereâ€™s the catch: Peptide lip products can be quite pricy due to the advanced research and technologies behind their formulations. Most cost between $15 and $30, which is a little steep considering you can buy a drugstore lip balm for around $5.

Intrigued â€” and in the name of providing fair and honest reviews â€” I decided to put eight of the most popular peptide lip treatments to the test to see which ones truly deliver on their promises. Spoiler alert: one contender totally blew me away â€” and itâ€™s only $9.

DashDividers_1_500x100

Rhode Peptide Lip Treatment in Vanilla, $20

Described as a â€œnourishing lip layerâ€ by founder Hailey Bieber, this TikTok-viral bestseller arguably kicked off the peptide lip product craze when it launched in 2022. Iâ€™m a late bloomer when it comes to embracing the Rhode hype, but this treatment made a great first impression. It adds a shiny, non-sticky glaze that sits atop my lips for hours. The consistency is my second-favorite among all the products Iâ€™ve tried. Besides the titular ingredient, the formula also features cupuaÃ§u (a type of cacao fruit that maintains skin elasticity) and babassu (an antioxidant that also hydrates the skin).

Some of my initial enthusiasm faded with repeated use. The vanilla scent was very yummy at first, but I got tired of it after using it for a couple of weeks, as it reminded me of artificial sweeteners. (There is an unscented version of the treatment, and all the Rhode Lip Tints are unscented.) While the texture feels soft and conditioning when I apply it, I donâ€™t find that it moisturizes my lips that much in the long term; I can still feel my lips craving moisture a few hours later, and it does little to heal gritty, flaky skin. I think itâ€™s a bit overhyped, but itâ€™d be a good fit for someone already blessed with well-hydrated lips who wants a coat of long-lasting shine and a side of dessert-inspired fragrance.

Shop Rhode

DashDividers_1_500x100

Paulaâ€™s Choice Pro-Collagen Peptide Gloss Balm, $24

Paulaâ€™s Choice is aiming for a piece of that peptide hype with its two new launches: The Pro-Collagen Peptide Moisturizer (which I enjoyed) and this gloss balm. Out of all the squeezy tube lip products I tested for this story, I liked the applicator on this one the most. It has a slightly curved tip that hugs the contours of the lips, making it easier to disperse just the right amount of product I need. It has a faint, sweet aroma that reminds me of cakes.

A lot of science has gone into the formula, namely three types of peptides â€” tridecapeptide-1, palmitoyl tripeptide-1, and palmitoyl tripeptide-38. I asked Dr. Emma Cunningham, medical director at Dr. Emma Clinics, to explain their benefits: â€œTripeptide has three amino acids [the building blocks of proteins] and is great for general skin repair, improving hydration and strengthening the skin barrier,â€ she says. â€œItâ€™s smaller, so it absorbs quickly and works quickly.â€ I can confirm that it works well, as I wake up with softer and more hydrated lips when Iâ€™ve slathered this treatment on before bed. My only gripe? It is quite expensive, and I fear I might go through the whole rube rather quickly.

Shop Sephora

DashDividers_1_500x100

Ole Henriksen Pout Preserve Peptide Lip Treatment, $23

I have Suni Lee to thank for discovering this gem. The Olympic gold medalist shouted out the product as part of her go-to lip combo, and it has since sold out many times over. I tried the citrus flavor and loved the subtle shimmer it imparts. In addition to peptides, itâ€™s enriched with kokum butter and mango seed butter, which add moisture to the lips. This is the most instantly hydrating treatment out of the bunch, but the texture is a bit too sticky for my liking. The brand says this can be applied over lip color to add extra shine, but it already feels like wearing a heavy coat on its own. I will likely save this one for when itâ€™s brutally cold, and my lips are very dry.

Shop Sephora

DashDividers_1_500x100

The Inkey List Tripeptide Plumping Lip Balm, $14

I had high hopes for this product, given how much our beauty director Jacqueline Kilikita loves The Inkey List. Itâ€™s formulated with a 6% tripeptide complex, which promises to smooth out fine lines on the lips, along with plumping and softening benefits. The product has a similar texture to a lip oil and doesnâ€™t irritate when I glide it across the cracked parts of my lips. I do notice my lips looking a bit fuller and more defined after a week, but I likely wonâ€™t finish the whole tube for one reason alone: it left a bitter, medicinal aftertaste. The product transferred easily, and I can always taste it as it seeps into the corners of my mouth.

Shop The Inkey List

DashDividers_1_500x100

Farmacy Lip Smoothie Vitamin C + Peptide Lip Balm, $22

This product is compared to Laneigeâ€™s viral Lip Sleeping Mask a lot, and after trying both, I would say that they are pretty much neck-and-neck, but thanks to the peptides, this lip smoothie leaves my lips feeling more pillowy soft the next morning. Iâ€™ll say that the moisturizing benefits arenâ€™t all that noticeable on their own, but it does dial up the efficacy of a lip serum or lip mask when you layer it on top (my favorite pairing has been Chanelâ€™s Hydra Beauty Lip Serum). It seals in all the goodness, and I love the apple scent and barely-there texture. However, at this price point, it hasnâ€™t impressed me enough, and I have to layer it with another product to get the best results. Its airy, whipped texture is a better fit for summer, especially since it contains vitamin C, an antioxidant that enhances sun protection.

Shop Ulta

DashDividers_1_500x100

Revolution Beauty Juicy Peptide Lip Balm, $9

This one is a sleeper hit that should be TikTok-viral, especially given the affordable price. I tried Ice, a clear color that adds a subtle pearly luster to my lips. Itâ€™s like wearing a Y2K-inspired shiny lip gloss without any of the stickiness. My lips feel instantly softer, with a moisturizing top layer that lingers long after I wipe the product off. I attribute this to squalane, an emollient that draws moisture to the skin, alongside nourishing peptides, vitamin E, and avocado oil. It has been my go-to product for prepping my lips before makeup, as it does a remarkable job at smoothing over the cracks, and Iâ€™m so drawn to the light grapefruit scent. This one gets an A+ from me: I simply donâ€™t get sick of this product and canâ€™t wait to try the tinted versions.

Shop Ulta

DashDividers_1_500x100

Allies of Skin Peptide & Ceramide Repair Lip Balm, $25

This is the perfect SOS treatment for when your lips are raw and irritated. Packed with ceramides, an ingredient I always look for in my moisturizer, it creates a protective barrier on the lips while working overtime to repair the cracks underneath. The bright yellow color comes from sea buckthorn oil, an antioxidant that helps reduce hyperpigmentation and inflammation. I have this next to me when I work from home, and I love the feeling of the cushiony balm over my lips. It proved its worth when my partner recently came home from a ski trip with severely chapped and scaly lips. He popped on this lip balm, and the flakiness disappeared overnight.

Shop Dermstore

DashDividers_1_500x100

Biossance Pro-Peptide Lip Perfector, $20

Given how often I use peptides, squalane, and hyaluronic acid in my skincare, I had high hopes for this one, which contains all three ingredients. The texture appears semi-coagulated, making it a bit too chunky to squeeze out of the tube, but it melts into a nourishing oil once on my lips. I did some research on the productâ€™s Sephora page, and the hard texture seems to be a common complaint after a recent reformulation; some even find the product gritty once applied on the lips, but I didnâ€™t feel any clumps. The product does a good job at making my lips bouncier and softer, but the ointment-like texture means that you really feel it weighing on your lips for hours on end.

Shop Sephora

Like what you see? How about some more R29 goodness, right here?

The Lesser-Known Acid Skin Experts Love For A Glow

Editor-Approved Moisturizers For Dry, Thirsty Skin

The Inkey List's $15 Retinal Transforms Dull Skin

title: 6 Tips That Helped Me Grow Longer, Stronger Hair (& No Trims In-Between)
text:
6 Tips That Helped Me Grow Longer, Stronger Hair (& No Trims In-Between)

In April 2021, when most coronavirus restrictions were lifted, and we rejoiced in our newfound freedom, the first thing I did was book into my local salon for a bob haircut. Lopping off five inches became something of a metaphor for shedding the past and starting afresh. Ever since then, the bob has been my hairstyle du jour.Â 

Iâ€™ve rocked the â€œbottleneckâ€ bob (so named for its face-framing fringe), the Italian bob (characterized by volume and chunky, blunt ends), and even the â€œboyfriendâ€ bob (arguably the shortest â€” and, surprisingly, most controversial â€” of the bunch). But last June, as I grappled with the flatiron (bobs are high maintenance, you know), I decided on a new hair goal: to grow my hair long and strong so that I didnâ€™t have to put as much heat on it, or style it constantly.

It grew at a snailâ€™s pace. No matter how many spiky silicone head massagers I collected, or how enthusiastically my beauty editor peers recommended biotin supplements (more on why I chose not to heed their advice later), my hair wouldnâ€™t pass my shoulders for what felt like forever.

In a bid to find out what was going on, I reached out to various hair experts, even paying a visit to the Philip Kingsley Trichological Clinic for a hair scan with trichologist Anabel Kingsley. What I learned transformed my hair-care regime as I knew it, and by December, my hair had grown a little over five inches. Fast-forward two months and my friends, family, and colleagues canâ€™t get over how quickly and effortlessly my hair seems to have sprouted.

I wonâ€™t gatekeep. This is everything the professionals taught me about growing longer, stronger, and healthier hair â€” and how to apply it to your own routine.

I wash my hair more often

Unsurprisingly, the TikTok-viral concept of â€œhair trainingâ€ â€” leaving your hair longer in between washes in the hope that your scalp produces less oil over time â€” is unfounded. Previously, Iâ€™d wash my hair once or twice a week, thinking that stretching out my wash days would preserve the integrity of my strands. But the trichologists I spoke to hinted that I was probably doing more harm to my growth cycle than good.Â 

In fact, not washing my hair regularly enough resulted in seborrheic dermatitis, an inflammatory condition that makes the scalp itchy and results in yellow, sticky flakes. Like dandruff, seborrheic dermatitis is caused by a common yeast called malassezia, and while this yeast is entirely normal, an oily environment causes it to multiply and wreak havoc on the scalp. â€œAs seborrheic dermatitis causes an imbalance, the hair can shed more quickly as it doesnâ€™t have the best growing conditions,â€ says Eva Proudman, a consultant trichologist. She explains that hair washing is more about cleansing the scalp â€” which is simply an extension of the face â€” than just the hair. â€œThe scalp has 180,000 oil glands, and these can, at different times in our lives, become more active and produce more oil,â€ says Proudman, hence the propensity for scalp imbalance. She continues, â€œThe scalp is the growing medium of the hair and needs to be balanced for optimum hair growth and hair health.â€Â 

Trichologist Anabel Kingsley agrees. She told me previously: â€œThe flaking of the scalp increases daily hair fall and impacts the integrity of the cuticle [the outermost layer of the hair strand], causing the growth of weaker hair.â€ To Kingsley, the scalp is your hairâ€™s â€œhomeâ€ and if itâ€™s in bad condition, itâ€™ll impact how your hair grows.Â 

Of course, how often you wash your hair is down to personal preference, but Proudman says that an ideal washing regime is every day or every other day for optimum scalp balance and hair growth conditions. (I opt for the latter.) Those with curly, coily, and kinky hair might want to stretch this to once a week.

I made my scalp the priority

I thought I knew how to wash my hair, but I was schooled during a hair spa treatment at Kingsleyâ€™s clinic, where an expert scrubbed my scalp for three minutes. They also focused less on my lengths. Since then, Iâ€™ve done the same for every wash, and Iâ€™m convinced that the exfoliating motion is keeping my flakes at bay. Interestingly, Proudman adds that consistent scalp massage can stimulate blood flow into the hair follicle to support hair growth.Â 

Seeing as I wash my hair more regularly now, I find that one wash is enough. â€œDouble cleansing your hair is generally only needed if you use lots of products or if you have a very oily scalp,â€ says Proudman. I just use a generous amount of shampoo to create a substantial lather and make sure that my hair is soaking wet first.Â 

While I wash my scalp more regularly now, I avoid putting conditioner and hair oils on my roots. Instead, and as suggested by Kingsley, I concentrate these on my mid-lengths and ends, which need the most moisture. Since doing so, Iâ€™ve realized that bombarding my scalp with thick products like these was only making it greasier and likely contributed to my flaky and itchy symptoms.Â Kingsley confirmed my suspicion. â€œItâ€™s not necessary to put conditioner on roots,â€ she told me. â€œIt can weigh the hair down, and if it contains oils, it could potentially exacerbate seborrheic dermatitis.â€ Though this worked for me, all hair types are different. Your roots might be particularly dry and require more moisture in the form of conditioner, masks, oils, and other treatments of your choice.

I discovered the smartest shampoo

Iâ€™ve always been skeptical about hair growth shampoos. How can something thatâ€™s only on your scalp for a few minutes at a time possibly have an impact on your strands? Happily, I was proven wrong when I discovered Typebea. Anna Lahey (founder of supplement brand Vida Glow) and Rita Ora (yes, really) are the brains behind the beauty editor-adored G1 Overnight Boosting Peptide Serum, and G2 Strength & Length Shampoo, $26, and Conditioner. Iâ€™m convinced all three have helped my hair grow longer and stronger.Â 

Itâ€™s all in the ingredients. First up is baicapil, which Proudman explains is a plant-based ingredient (a combination of wheat sprouts and soybean) and is often used in hair products. Lahey reports that itâ€™s clinically proven to boost growth and reduce hair loss by 60%. There are a small handful of studies that suggest baicapil is an effective hair growth treatment. According to Lahey, baicapil has the power to improve hair density, strengthen follicles, and enhance scalp health, resulting in thicker, more resilient lengths over time.Â 

Then thereâ€™s salicylic acid. â€œThis gently exfoliates the scalp, removing dead skin cells, product, and oil buildup, and balancing oil production,â€ says Lahey. Proudman adds that salicylic acid keeps the hair follicles clear, which supports healthy hair growth. Lastly, the shampoo and scalp serum boast provitamin B5, aka panthenol, to moisturize the hair and keep that moisture under lock and key. Proudman says that provitamin B5 also â€œsmooths the hair to give a good shine and protection from damageâ€.Â 

All of these ingredients have been studied and can provide benefits to the hair and scalp, continues Proudman, but she adds that itâ€™s important to note that the formulation â€” and amount of these ingredients â€” determines how effective a product will be. In my honest opinion, as a beauty director who has tried my fair share of hair growth products, Typebeaâ€™s are the only ones that have worked for me. When I rinse away the Strength & Length Shampoo and wring out the water, itâ€™s like it has worked magic to beef up my strands. Not only is my hair longer, but it feels twice as thick. Iâ€™ve been through a handful of bottles of the shampoo and conditioner in particular â€” and Iâ€™m already stocking up on more.Â 

I used minoxidil â€” but consistency is key

If youâ€™re still skeptical about hair growth shampoos and serums, and youâ€™re experiencing hair loss or thinning in particular, you might want to consider trying minoxidil: a proven treatment for androgenetic alopecia (hair loss caused by a combination of genetics and hormones). â€œMinoxidil is a vasodilator that pulls blood flow into the hair follicle,â€ explains Proudman. â€œIt stimulates the hair follicles to enter into the growing phase and remain there for longer.â€ Minoxidil also increases the diameter of the hair, says Proudman, improving overall hair density on the scalp.

For full disclosure, I used Rogaine (an over-the-counter version of minoxidil) every day for three weeks last August, concentrating the product to a sparse patch on my left temple. But consistency is key. â€œIt can take three to six months to see the effects of minoxidil,â€ says Proudman, â€œand it needs to be applied to the scalp, not the hair, consistently as advised.â€Â 

When I discovered Typebea, I shelved the minoxidil after a few weeks to see if the serum, shampoo, and conditioner would do anything. While that sparse patch is more or less unchanged, the length elsewhere is impressive. Itâ€™s important to note that while Typebea claims that its four-step system can reduce hair fall â€” how often your hair falls out on its own naturally â€” it doesnâ€™t tackle hair loss.Â 

Minoxidil also has a few potential side effects. â€œThe most common can be scalp irritation, slight lowering of blood pressure, and an increase in heart rate,â€ says Proudman. In some cases, it can trigger more hair to shed as your hair enters the growing phase, continues Proudman, and this is likely to last for around four to six weeks.

I stopped going to sleep with wet hair

A dermatologist told me recently that hair is at its weakest point when wet, which encourages breakage. For that reason, I now always whip my hair up after washing it into a microfibre towel like Kitsch Microfibre Hair Towel Wrap, which Iâ€™m convinced is gentler on my strands, and I rough-dry my hair before bed rather than letting it dry naturally overnight. I like to use a speedy, lightweight hairdryer like Shark SpeedStyle Pro FLEX Professional Performance High-Velocity Hair Dryer System.

I also learned to brush my hair properly. â€œGet in the habit of brushing your hair from the ends,â€ Kingsley told me. She added that if you tend to start at the top or mid-lengths, youâ€™re putting lots of tension on your strands â€” a fast track to breakage. When my hair is wet, I use a wide-tooth comb like Mane Knot Ur Avg Wide-Tooth Hair Comb, and when itâ€™s dry, I use a paddle brush, which brushes comfortably and doesnâ€™t ever tug.Â Â Â 

I avoided pointless supplements

Proudman told R29 that a poor diet and low levels of vitamins and minerals such as ferritin, vitamin B12, vitamin D, and zinc may cause both hair shedding and slow growth. A blood test showed that I was deficient in vitamin D, and now I take a supplement. Besides vitamin D, youâ€™ve likely heard that biotin, or vitamin B7, can encourage better hair growth. But hereâ€™s the thing: You might not actually need it.

Sally-Anne Tarver, a trichologist at the Cotswold Trichology Center, previously told R29 that biotin supplements are only likely to work for people who have a deficiency. She said that such a deficiency is very rare in the Western world. â€œSimply stuffing [in] more biotin if you donâ€™t need it will not result in healthier hair growth,â€ said Tarver. What it could do, though, is provide incorrect blood test results and even lead to hormonal issues.Â

Hairline Microblading Is Koreaâ€™s Fix For Thinning

title: Buckle Up! Venus In Aquarius Is Going To Be A Bumpy Ride
text:
Buckle Up! Venus In Aquarius Is Going To Be A Bumpy Ride

AsÂ expected, Venus in Aquarius is going to shake up our world in unpredictable and erratic ways â€” so buckle up because the ride is about to get bumpy from January 17thÂ to February 10th. The planet of social connections and romance is often more methodical, open-minded, and progressive whenÂ it comes toÂ the lastÂ Air sign of the zodiacÂ â€” andÂ thatâ€™sÂ notÂ a bad thing.Â Â 

DuringÂ this time, relationships can become unconventional, which means thatÂ weâ€™reÂ more open to seeking different qualities in a partner or making advances towards commitment in unique ways. Fundamentally, we are looking to connect with like-minded people, while also enjoying debates and meetings with opposingÂ views.Â Basically, itâ€™sÂ not a boring transit!Â 

Venus in Aquarius is going to share a harsh aspect with Uranus retrograde in Taurus. The square betweenÂ bothÂ planets is going to be wild becauseÂ weâ€™llÂ wish to relinquish relationships or friendships thatÂ donâ€™tÂ appeal to us anymore. TheÂ caveatÂ is that we willÂ probably wantÂ to get back together with these people several times in between the end of Venus in Aquariusâ€™s stint, soÂ donâ€™tÂ say words or be a part of actions that youÂ canâ€™tÂ take back or apologize for. The situationshipÂ youâ€™veÂ been a part of might end on your accord, only for you to send a late-night text days later to reignite it. The back and forth might be dizzying, butÂ itâ€™sÂ par for the course. Also, think twice before blocking or unfollowing. The same applies here, too.Â 

Take note:Â Venus in Aquarius is bringingÂ healing energy, too. Although we are going to feel likeÂ weâ€™reÂ on a roller coaster ride throughout the journey, we are gaining knowledge and help from the community and world at large to help us mend our wounds and trauma. It is a glorious time to seek advice and wisdom from others to get clarity on what we want to focus on and grow.Â IfÂ we pay tribute to thoseÂ whoâ€™veÂ inspired and motivated us, we will pay the sentiment forward and gain insight that we can spread to others.Â Â 

Remember the water bearer takesÂ great joyÂ from imparting its knowledge to the universe andÂ assistingÂ those it cares about. TheÂ caveatÂ is that they have an aloof way of showing it. The reason is that Aquarius is the watery part ofÂ Air, so it has the emotion and intuition that all water signsÂ possess, and they express it straightforwardly and concisely, like anÂ Air sign. IfÂ youâ€™reÂ looking for declarations of love, thisÂ isnâ€™tÂ the time for that. But ifÂ youâ€™reÂ looking for companionship, loyalty, flirtations, and camaraderie, then Venus in Aquarius will aid you in that capacity.Â 

A great placeÂ to meet a potential romantic partner is on dating apps. Venus in Aquarius is a tech-savvy individual, making it an ideal spot for those seeking love. Rather than spend a night on the town with a friend or significant other, take that cash and donate it to a philanthropic organization that is meaningful to you.Â 

Important Astrological Dates:Â 

January 17th: Venus enters Aquarius, pushing us to be demure and logical when it comes to our affections.Â 

January 19th: Venus forms a conjunction with Pluto in Aquarius, spicing up our desires and jealousies. Arguments are popping off due to triangular situations and power struggles. The temperature may be cold outside, but that isÂ notÂ the case behind closed doors.Â 

February 4th: Venus in Aquarius harmonizes with the centaur Chiron in Aries, urging us to evolve our bodies, minds, and spirits. We hold the key to our own healing.Â 

February 8th: Venus in AquariusÂ squares UranusÂ retrograde in Taurus, allowing us to break out of unhealthy or stagnant situations that are holding us back from living our most authentic lives.Â 

February 10th: Venus swims into Pisces for the next few weeks, allowing us to accept others and ourselves for who we truly are â€” no strings attached.Â

title: Winter Dress Trends â€” Like Plaid & Capes â€” To Wear All Season Long
text:
Winter Dress Trends â€” Like Plaid & Capes â€” To Wear All Season Long

Frost is nipping at our noses â€” which means our winter dress coats and knee-high boots are officially back in rotation. As your winter dresses make their seasonal debut, itâ€™s the perfect time to refresh a few favorites.

This season especially calls for long-sleeve dresses across cozy knit and velvet fabrics, elevated blazer and cape designs, plus bundled-up high-neck and maxi silhouettes. Many of these trendy winter dresses can be worn for everything from work to winter weddings (and all the celebrations throughout the season, like Valentineâ€™s Day). And we promise that plaids and velvets are way more versatile than just being worn for the holidays.

Ahead, shop the best cool-weather picks to achieve trendy winter aesthetics from reader-favorite retailers like Nordstrom, Free People, and H&M.

DashDividers_1_500x100

Sweater Dresses

Whether youâ€™re dressing for the office, a cozy dinner, a log cabin getaway, or a window-shopping stroll, itâ€™s time to embrace sweater weather. From plush cashmere and merino wool to ribbed jersey knits, these sweater dresses are equal parts warm and comfortable. We found styles in a range of lengths with turtlenecks, belts, and cardigan-esque designs that arenâ€™t so basic, yet still versatile.

DashDividers_1_500x100

Velvet Dresses

When it comes to winter fabrics, velvet is the undisputed favorite. Itâ€™s soft, tactile, and undeniably luxe â€” perfect for winter cocktail parties, especially when in drapey silhouettes. For other seasonal occasions, like date nights, weâ€™ve also spotted darling mini dresses with playful details like sequins and lace for extra texture and interest.

DashDividers_1_500x100

Plaid Dresses

Just as classic plaid coats are trending, so are plaid dresses. While gingham shines in the warmer months, slightly festive and edgy plaids and tartans in deep color combos are perfect throughout the winter. So, whether youâ€™re looking to re-style your favorite holiday dresses or are shopping for a new dress, plaid is your friend. Find the print across mini, midi, and maxi lengths for every vibe and occasion.

DashDividers_1_500x100

Blazer Dresses

Continuing the 2025 fashion trend train, bold shoulders and soft suiting are still popular, so itâ€™s no wonder blazer dresses are having a moment. This suit alternative lets you bring the business vibes while showing a bit of leg. Plus, thicker velvet and faux leather fabrics, as well as details like neck scarves, mean you donâ€™t have to sacrifice warmth. Just add fleece-lined tights and over-the-knee boots to fully winter-proof your look.

DashDividers_1_500x100

Cape Dresses

Weâ€™ve been seeing cape dresses more frequently, especially across awards season red carpets, so weâ€™re embracing the celebrity-backed trend. Ethereal sheer capes, attached scarves, and removable sleeves are especially popping up across our favorite retailers. Cape dresses make for the ideal winter wedding guest style, especially if youâ€™re looking for a little extra coverage and warmth, sans stiff or sweaty long sleeves.

DashDividers_1_500x100

High-Neck Dresses

This awards season has also highlighted high-neck gowns, which is perhaps surprising, but certainly seasonally appropriate. From turtlenecks and mock necks to cowl necks and boatnecks, these dresses are reserved, but still chic and flirty. And luckily, thereâ€™s a range of fabrics and lengths that are perfect for professional work settings, casual family gatherings, romantic date nights, and black-tie parties.

title: The Lesser-Known Acid Skincare Experts Love For A Year-Round Glow
text:
The Lesser-Known Acid Skincare Experts Love For A Year-Round Glow

If I were to rifle through your currentÂ skincare lineup,Â Iâ€™dÂ betÂ Iâ€™dÂ find at least one of the following:Â salicylic acid,Â glycolic acid, orÂ lactic acid. Thanks to brands likeÂ The Ordinary, Paulaâ€™s Choice,Â andÂ Drunk Elephant,Â exfoliating acids have become staples in many routines.Â (Donâ€™tÂ ask me to pick a favorite â€”Â Iâ€™mÂ loyal to all three.)Â From unclogging pores to fading hyperpigmentation and brightening dull skin, their benefits are well documented, butÂ thereâ€™sÂ anotherÂ acidÂ quietlyÂ vying forÂ your attention,Â and if you have sensitive skin,Â might just replace whatÂ youâ€™reÂ using now.Â 

Enter:Â citricÂ acid.Â 

What is citric acid,Â and how does it work in skincare?Â 

Mariam Abbas, an advanced facialist,Â says citric acid isÂ basically anÂ acid â€” specifically an alpha hydroxy acid (AHA) â€” and it comes from citrus fruits, which is where it gets its name.Â 

â€œIn high enough concentrations, citric acid can have an exfoliating effect on the skin,â€ says Abbas. It encourages old or dead skin cells to shed, revealing fresh, new cells and improving the appearance of dull skin, Abbas explains. It can also help unclog pores and prevent new breakouts, but it does all of this with far less irritation: â€œCitric acid is gentler than other alpha hydroxy acids,â€ she says. This is because its larger moleculesÂ arenâ€™tÂ absorbed into the skin as easily as glycolic acidâ€™s much smaller ones. â€œAs such, it is better tolerated as an exfoliating agent by sensitive skin,â€ says Abbas.Â 

Is citric acid good for the skin?Â 

Besides gentle exfoliation, Abbas says citric acid also has anÂ antioxidant effectÂ on the skin, helping protect it from things like smoke and pollution that can cause dullness or congestion. Not only that, but it can also boost the effectiveness of other antioxidants like trustyÂ vitamin C: â€œIn this way, it can indirectly have a brightening effect on the skin when used in combination with actives like vitamin C,â€ explains Abbas.Â Thatâ€™sÂ whyÂ youÂ mightÂ spot it on the ingredient list of your favoriteÂ vitamin CÂ moisturizer or serum.Â Â 

How do you use citric acid in a skincare routine?Â 

Because citric acid is such a beneficial addition, it appears in a wide range of skincare products, but mostly exfoliators.Â More often than not, citric acid is combined with other exfoliating acids, like glycolic or lactic acid â€” both of which also brighten the skin, unclog pores, and minimize hyperpigmentation. Think of citric acid as the supporting actor in yourÂ exfoliatingÂ cleansers, toners, leave-on exfoliators, or serums.Â Â 

One of our favoriteÂ productsÂ â€” and a staple in manyÂ beautyÂ editorsâ€™ skin, hair, and body routines â€” isÂ The Ordinary Glycolic Acid 7% Toner. While glycolic acid is the star ingredient, citric acid also smoothsÂ rough texture, boostsÂ radiance, and exfoliatesÂ skin. Top tip: It works just as well on aÂ flaky scalpÂ orÂ rough feetÂ as it does on your face.Â 

If leave-on toners tend to irritate your skin, consider aÂ wash-offÂ cleanser instead. Abbas recommendsÂ Skin Better Science Refining Foam Cleanser, which combines citric acid with gentle AHA lactic acid and BHA salicylic acid. The salicylic acid penetrates a little deeper into the pores to break up the glue-like mixture of oil and dead skin cells that can lead to breakouts. If you have less to spend, tryÂ TheÂ InkeyÂ Listâ€™s Salicylic Acid Cleanser, also with salicylicÂ and citric acids.Â 

Because citric acid has antioxidant benefits,Â youâ€™llÂ alsoÂ spot it inside plenty of brightening serumsÂ alongside vitamin C.Â TryÂ SkinfixÂ Barrier+ Serum with 15% vitamin CÂ and antioxidant ferulic acid, orÂ The Ordinaryâ€™s Multi-Antioxidant Radiance Serum, withÂ ascorbylÂ glucoside â€” a version of vitamin CÂ thatâ€™sÂ kinder on reactive skin.Â Â 

Are there any downsides to using citric acid in a skincare routine?Â 

Lastly,Â Abbas notes that, like any exfoliant, citric acid can cause dryness, irritation, or sensitivity if overused or used inÂ very highÂ concentrations. She adds thatÂ itâ€™sÂ also sometimes added as a fragrance in skincare, which could trigger allergic reactions or irritation in those with perfume-sensitive skin. If this sounds familiar,Â itâ€™sÂ always worthÂ patch-testingÂ any new skincare product before applying it to your face. Try the inner elbow, neck, or the area behind your ear.Â 

Explore our top citric acid skincare picks below.Â Â

title: We Did The Research & These Are The Best Golden Globes Looks Since 1989
text:
We Did The Research & These Are The Best Golden Globes Looks Since 1989 On Sunday, millions of people tuned into the 83rd Golden Globe Awards for the annual star-studded occasion and the official kickoff of this yearâ€™s awards season. And, of course, the red carpet fashion was all the talk.

In celebration of this red carpet's return, we're looking back decades to show off the best red carpet looks from each year between 2026 to 1989 â€” that is, except for 2008, when the Writers Guild of America went on strike and the whole event was canceled, and 2022, when backlash against the Hollywood Foreign Press put the award ceremony on hold.

From the white satin gown Audrey Hepburn donned while receiving the Cecil B. DeMille Award in 1990 to Saoirse Ronan's #METOO-inspired black Versace gown in 2018 to Teyana Taylor's bedazzled whale tale moment this year, these are the best looks we've seen in over three decades of the Golden Globes.
